required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Sensor and Software Use for Improved Glucose Control in MDI Managed Diabetes
clinical_study.official_title: Sensor and Software Use for Improved Glucose Control in MDI Managed Diabetes

primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 86 to 100 compared to Day 1 to 15
primary_outcome.description: Intervention arm: within subject difference in time in range (70-180 mg/dL, 3.9 to 10.0 mmol/L) in final 15 days compared to baseline phase assessed separately for Type 1 and Type 2 Diabetes.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Days 86 to 100 intervention arm compared to control arm
secondary_outcome.description: Difference in time in range (70-180 mg/dL, 3.9 to 10.0 mmol/L) intervention arm compared to control arm.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 86 to 100 compared to day 1 to 15

arm_group.description: Following a 14 day masked (baseline) period using the FreeStyle Navigator subjects will wear an unmasked FreeStyle Navigator with the glucose alarms switched off.

Following a 14 day masked ( baseline) period using the FreeStyle Navigator subjects will manage their blood glucose with a standard SMBG and use a FreeStyle Navigator masked for a 14 day period at the end of the study.

intervention.description: Masked CGM day 1 to 15, unmasked CGM days 15 to 100
Masked CGM days 1 to 15, standard SMBG days 15 to 86, masked CGM day 86 to 100

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age 18 years and over
- Type 1 diabetes on MDI with bolus injections for >6 months prior to study enrolment or Type 2 diabetes treated with 2 or more insulin injections daily.
- In the investigator's opinion, thought technically capable of using FreeStyle Navigator GM System device.
- HbA1c between 7.5 and 12.0% (58 to 108 mmol/mol) for previous test obtained within 6 months prior to point of enrolment
Exclusion Criteria:
- Concomitant disease or condition that may compromise patient safety, including unstable coronary heart disease, cystic fibrosis, serious psychiatric disorder, or any uncontrolled chronic medical condition
- Female subject is pregnant or planning to become pregnant within the planned study duration. Subjects who become pregnant during the study will be discontinued from the study.
- Currently using / has previously used a Continuous Glucose Monitoring System within the last 6 months.
- Currently using Continuous Subcutaneous Insulin Infusion (CSII)
- Currently using basal/long acting insulin only.
- Participating in another study of a glucose monitoring device / drug that could affect glucose measurements / management
- Known allergy to medical grade adhesives
- In the investigators opinion is unsuitable to participate due to any other cause/reason.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A total of 105 subjects consented and enrolled into the study. Eighteen of these withdrew before randomisation or failed screening. Eighty-seven (87) subjects were randomised and 79 completed the study.

group.title: CGM - Intervention Arm - Type 1 Diabetes
group.description: Following a 14 day masked (baseline) period using the FreeStyle Navigator subjects will wear an unmasked FreeStyle Navigator with the glucose alarms switched off. FreeStyle Navigator: Masked CGM day 1 to 15, unmasked CGM days 15 to 100

group.title: SMBG - Control Arm - Type 1 Diabetes
group.description: Following a 14 day masked ( baseline) period using the FreeStyle Navigator subjects will manage their blood glucose with a standard SMBG and use a FreeStyle Navigator masked for a 14 day period at the end of the study. Standard SMBG: Masked CGM days 1 to 15, standard SMBG days 15 to 86, masked CGM day 86 to 100

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events collected from enrollment to completion by last subject (8 months)
reported_events.desc: In addition to the adverse events listed below, one subject who withdrew from the study before randomisation reported Menieres disease.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Snr Director, Clinical Development & Regulatory Affairs
